content.description: Beautiful line with hard movement. Start low on a left quarter-pad crimp and right on a sloping half-moon shaped dish. The right foot is FAR away, you have to press on it hard to pull your hips up. Pull off the ground to gain a right sidepull crimp above, then gear up for a monster bump to the jug-shelf above. The climb is basically 3 difficult right hand bumps and a mantle. Every move is it's own crux. Hard, sharp, small holds and lots of body tension, but very cool movement.
content.protection: Multiple pads, no spotter as you're landing on another boulder right behind you.
content.location: Start at the north-west lookout area, and head south-east on trail for maybe 500-600 feet, then turn off trail and go uphill. The beer boulder is hidden and halfway uphill on the south-west facing hill with the huge boulders at the top. This climb starts dead in the middle of the face, wedged between the 2 boulders. The rock is a specific red shade that contrasts with surroundings.

content.description: Starts on the lowest right side of the boulder(if looking at the face) with a low left sidepull and a higher right hand pinch. Work on good and sharp holds up and left into the shelf that tops out "Just Beer" and mantle.
content.protection: Pads for landing(the landing is another boulder sloping away from you)
content.location: Just uphill off the trail that heads north-northwest from the campground. This particular hill has huge boulders on top that are visible from all around the area. Beer boulder is about halfway up the hill and very secluded.
